subject: RE: [OT] coverage plugins for eclipse?
msgSnippet: Kent Beck Mon, 5 Sep 2005 11:33:33 -0700 ... Perhaps then http://www.junit.org/news/extension/index.htm could get a section for coverage tools? (I dunno how to
messageBody:
Kent Beck Mon, 5 Sep 2005 11:33:33 -0700
> I don't think this coverage is off-topic at all, since the coverage
> testers I've tried all use JUnit tests to initiate execution of the
> code.

Perhaps then

http://www.junit.org/news/extension/index.htm

could get a section for coverage tools? (I dunno how to request or
make changes on junit.org.) Or is there another public resource for
recording this kind of information? Meanwhile ...

> We used Coverlipse first. I liked the user interface (you initiate
> coverage measurement with a new kind of launch configuration), but
> the results weren't accurate. We set breakpoints on lines that the
> tool claimed weren't covered and execution stopped there. We also
> tried Clover, which has a slightly less natural interface (you set
> an "enable Clover" flag on the project properties). The results,
> however, seemed much more accurate.

... I'll add that to our internal coverage-tools wiki.
